workflow.name: The title is very good, clearly conveying the template's purpose while mentioning key technologies
workflow.description:
## How it works
- Collects articles from your preferred RSS feeds. 
- Rates and tags each article using an AI model (e.g., QWEN 14B-s4), filtering for relevance and quality. 
- Summarizes high-rated articles with a language model (e.g., Gemma3 4B) for quick, digestible reading. 
- Checks for duplicates to avoid sending the same article twice. 
- Formats and sends the top articles as an HTML newsletter via Gmail, using OAuth2 authentication. 
- Stores records in a Postgres database, tracking which articles have been sent and their ratings.

## Requirements
- Postgres Account
- AI Models (if you work localy use Ollama)
- In the cloud you have to change Ollama node to your prefered Model Node
- RSS Feed of your desire
- Google Auth2, if you want to use Gmail

## Recommendations
- Use n8n local version for this workflow
- Here are some more informations: https://github.com/falks-ai-workbench/n8n_newsletter

parameters.subject: AI News

parameters.content:
## Compare Datasets and reduce data
- Word_count Code node is just for future Dashboards

## Rate Articles, summarize. Just keep articles who have a rating 7+
- Download from Ollama: Model QWEN3 14B-q4 and Model gemma3:latest or choose one of your local models

## Save data
- save the low rated and high rated articles into the table

nodes.name: Create DB and Schema if not exists

parameters.text:
=You are a helpful summarizer.

{{ $json.content }}

Goal
Write a summary of maximum 170 words.

Rules
Do NOT translate the text.

Always use the same language as the input text.

If the input is in German, write the summary in German. If the input is in English, write the summary in English. If the input is in another language, use that language for the summary.

Do not add any explanations or comments.

Output JSON:
{
"title": "{{ $json.title }}",
"summary": "..."
}

parameters.content:
## Change here
- Your Email
- Your Google Auth2

assignments.name: my_interests
assignments.value:
=My interests are:
1. AI Automation
2. MCP - Model Context Protocol
3. RAG Retrieval Augmented Generation
4. European AI Act
5. No Code or Low Code AI Tools

parameters.content:
## Change here
- Postgres Creds
- RSS Feed

## Change here
- Trigger manually
- or schedule (deactivated)

## Change here
- Style and headline of your Newsletter

main.node: Create DB and Schema if not exists

user.name: Falk
user.bio: Freelancer who loves to dig into new technologies and travel around the world

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
